title: Ripple CEO furious at SEC chief! - Cointribune EN
content:
Fri 09 Jun 2023 ▪ 2 min of reading ▪ by La Rédaction C.

The SEC has been on a witch hunt against crypto firms for several weeks now. It staunchly defends its position to clean up the American crypto industry and promote its growth. However, many players in this industry do not see the regulator’s actions in the same light.

The SEC CEO: Between farce and hypocrisy?

Recently, Gary Gensler, the head of the SEC, officially filed lawsuits against the crypto platform Binance. This move provided an opportunity for him to publish a list of 61 cryptocurrencies that are considered unregistered securities.

Following this, the SEC official expressed the underlying reasons for his regulatory policy. In a recent interview, Gary Gensler hinted that it is motivated by a desire to stimulate innovation.

“We don’t need more digital currencies,” declared the SEC leader. These statements sparked outrage within the crypto community. Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse was particularly incensed by the financier’s response.

On Twitter, the Ripple CEO didn’t hesitate to point out the hypocrisy of such a statement, especially considering that just a few hours earlier, the SEC had added Binance to the list of crypto companies it is suing.

Garlinghouse’s remarks shed light on the perception of the crypto industry towards the SEC. Both the institution and its leader are despised by the crypto community. This trend is unlikely to change as long as they continue to be subjected to the inconsistent regulatory policies imposed by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

A A Lien copié

title: Ripple vs. SEC Shakes Crypto Exchanges! Find Out What It Means for Coinbase and Binance! - Coinpedia Fintech News
content:
Qadir Ak is the founder of Coinpedia. He has over a decade of experience writing about technology and has been covering the blockchain and cryptocurrency space since 2010. He has also interviewed a few prominent experts within the cryptocurrency space.

The ongoing legal battle between Ripple and the SEC has taken a crucial turn with Judge Torres’ ruling on whether XRP tokens are securities. This decision carries significant implications for major crypto exchanges Coinbase and Binance, potentially altering the course of the industry. James Murphy, Founder of MetaLawMan has delved into the potential outcomes and what they mean for the future of cryptocurrencies.

1/ The stakes just keep getting higher for the ruling in SEC v. @Ripple.



Here's why.



If Judge Torres rules that $XRP tokens trading on secondary markets are Not Securities–it would undermine the entire basis for the SEC's case against @Coinbase and much of the @Binance case. — MetaLawMan (@MetaLawMan) June 8, 2023

Ripple’s XRP Tokens: A Threat to the SEC’s Case

If Judge Torres concludes that XRP tokens traded on secondary markets are not securities, the SEC’s case against Coinbase and Binance loses its foundation. This challenges the allegations of unregistered securities exchanges and broker-dealers, potentially favoring the exchanges in their legal battles.

Coinbase’s Case and Token Classification

Coinbase faces SEC accusations that 13 tokens listed on its platform are securities, accusing the exchange of illegal operation. However, if these tokens are not considered securities, the SEC’s case against Coinbase weakens considerably. Judge Rearden, overseeing the Coinbase case, is expected to pay close attention to Torres’ legal reasoning.

Also Read – Why Did SEC List Only Some Cryptos as Securities? Will There Be an Impact on Their Market Value?

The Influence of Judge Rearden

Judge Rearden’s role becomes crucial in the Coinbase case, as her analysis of Torres’ ruling on XRP’s security classification could shape her decision regarding the 13 tokens. While judges have the freedom to disagree, Rearden’s relative inexperience might lead her to consider the expertise of her fellow judge in this consequential case.

Potential Implications and Questions

The outcome of Torres’ ruling holds implications for both sides. Should XRP tokens be deemed securities, the SEC gains leverage in their cases against Coinbase and Binance. Conversely, if XRP tokens are not classified as securities, it brings relief to Ripple and prompts thought-provoking questions: How will this decision impact the regulation of cryptocurrencies? Can other tokens challenge the SEC’s classification?

Considering the Challenges Ahead

In analyzing the case, the involvement of Binance adds complexity since it issued its own token, BNB. Moreover, the SEC could still argue that certain practices, like “staking-as-a-service,” constitute securities offerings. However, such arguments may weaken the SEC’s overall case, leaving room for interpretation and future legal debates.

As the Ripple vs. SEC lawsuit unfolds, Judge Torres’ ruling on the status of XRP tokens reverberates across the crypto landscape. The decision has far-reaching consequences for Coinbase, Binance, and the industry as a whole.

Will the ruling set a precedent for future regulatory battles? How will the crypto community respond to this pivotal moment? While we await the final verdict, the outcome of this case will undoubtedly shape the future trajectory of cryptocurrencies and their relationship with regulators.

Also, Read – Ripple Execs Join Coinbase Battle: Will XRP be Relisted?

title: Ripple CEO attacks the SEC - The Cryptonomist
content:
The CEO of Ripple, Brad Garlinghouse, has openly criticized the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and its approach to the cryptocurrency industry.

In a recent interview, Garlinghouse expressed his concerns about the SEC’s legal actions against major exchanges such as Coinbase and Binance, suggesting that it is merely a diversionary tactic.

Brad Garlinghouse, CEO of Ripple, downplays SEC recent attack on exchanges

According to Garlinghouse, the SEC’s recent legal actions are an attempt to deflect attention from its mismanagement of the FTX debacle.

Garlinghouse believes the SEC is using these lawsuits as a smokescreen to distract attention from its own regulatory failures.

Garlinghouse’s criticism stems from his belief that the SEC’s actions are hindering innovation in the cryptocurrency industry.

He argues that the agency’s approach is overly cautious and does not foster an environment conducive to technological advances.

As CEO of Ripple, a company that has faced its own legal battles with the SEC, Garlinghouse has every interest in promoting a regulatory landscape more conducive to innovation.

The Ripple CEO’s comments highlight the ongoing tension between regulators and cryptocurrency companies.

While some argue that stricter regulation is necessary to protect investors and maintain market stability, others, like Garlinghouse, believe that excessive regulation stifles innovation and inhibits growth.

Garlinghouse is not alone in making accusations against the SEC

Garlinghouse is not the only one criticizing the SEC. Many industry experts and cryptocurrency enthusiasts have expressed similar concerns about the agency’s regulatory stance.

They argue that the SEC’s approach is outdated and fails to capture the full potential of blockchain technology and digital assets.

One of the main issues raised by Garlinghouse and others is the lack of clarity in existing regulations.

The SEC’s classification of cryptocurrencies as securities has been the subject of debate and confusion. This ambiguity creates uncertainty for companies operating in the cryptocurrency space, making it difficult for them to navigate the regulatory landscape.

In addition, Garlinghouse believes that the SEC’s actions against exchanges such as Coinbase and Binance send a negative message to the broader cryptocurrency community.

These platforms are important players in the industry, and targeting them with legal actions undermines trust and creates a sense of fear and uncertainty.

Instead of resorting to legal battles, Garlinghouse suggests that regulators should focus on engaging in meaningful dialogue with industry players.

He advocates a collaborative approach that allows for open discussion on how to strike the right balance between investor protection and innovation.

Although Garlinghouse’s criticism may be considered self-serving given Ripple’s legal problems with the SEC, his concerns about overregulation and its impact on the industry are shared by many.

The cryptocurrency space is evolving rapidly, and it is critical that regulators keep pace with technological advances rather than stifling them.

It is worth noting that the SEC has a responsibility to protect investors and maintain market integrity.

However, striking the right balance between regulation and innovation is a complex task.

The SEC should strive to develop clear and transparent guidelines that promote responsible innovation and foster the growth of the cryptocurrency industry.

Conclusions

In conclusion, Brad Garlinghouse’s criticism of the SEC’s legal actions against major exchanges reflects the ongoing tension between regulators and the cryptocurrency industry.

While the SEC’s actions may be intended to protect investors, they are seen by some as a diversionary tactic. Garlinghouse, along with others in the industry, believes that a more innovation-friendly regulatory approach is needed to promote growth and ensure the long-term success of the crypto space.

Finding the right balance between regulation and innovation remains a challenge, and an open dialogue between regulators and industry stakeholders is key to addressing these concerns and shaping the future of the cryptocurrency industry.

title: The Bullish Month of XRP: A 23% Increase In Value Sparks The Question: 'Is It Still A Good Investment?' - Inside Bitcoins
content:
Don’t invest unless prepared to lose all the money you invest. This is a high-risk investment, you shouldn’t expect to be protected if something goes wrong.

Join Our Telegram channel to stay up to date on breaking news coverage

Ripple blockchain is the true meaning of tenacity and resilience. Despite a rough two years with the US SEC, the cross-border network seems almost out of the woods.

In a month when Bitcoin and Ethereum are losing their spark, Ripple’s $XRP has been the shining beacon and pumped over 24% in the last 30 days.

This significant turn in fortune has driven many investors to ask if $XRP is still a good long-term investment.

Meanwhile, crypto experts are also buying into another disruptive crypto project called DeeLance.

XRP Posts Well Over 24% In Past Month – A Resurgence on the Horizon?

The crypto market is still reeling from growing regulatory scrutiny from the US government. So far, Binance and Coinbase have been added to the Securities and Exchange Commission’s (SEC) legal blackbook.

Trading volume has plunged and driven the market cap to the lower ends of $1 trillion.

Bitcoin has struggled to break above $27,000 for a week, but $XRP has continued its bullish breakout.

At press time, the $XRP token is trading at $0.53, indicating an uptrend of 1.83%. The asset’s weekly performance is also in the green zone, with 5.23% growth experienced in the past seven days.

However, the real interest lies in the $ XRP’s monthly performance. The digital asset has posted 24.27% in the last 30 days, with the 90 days growth up by 44.09%.

Its six months performance stands at 37.9%, with its year-to-date (YTD) up 57.27%.

Turning to the technicals, $XRP is trading above its 50-day simple moving average (SMA) indicator price of $0.47. The token’s long-term 200-day SMA is also below the current price and stands at $0.42.

Turning to other indicators, $XRP’s relative strength index (RSI) is pushing toward the overbought region with an oscillator figure of 62.93. Also, its moving average convergence divergence (MACD) shows a strong buy signal.

$XRP’s swift pivot has been due to its ongoing legal tussle with the SEC, which is expected to conclude in the next couple of weeks.

So far, all indicators point to Ripple winning the case that $XRP is not a security. Recently, the US regulator has seen its request to seal the Hinman documents refused, indicating another court victory for the defendant.

Court victory for @Ripple as judge denies SEC motion to seal Hinman docs. The future of the entire crypto world is in the hands of Judge Torres and it seems like she is pro #XRP! pic.twitter.com/PQkO2gA2OD — JackTheRippler ©️ (@RippleXrpie) June 8, 2023

This has boosted investor sentiment around the cross-border asset, increasing buying pressure around it.

Also, its recent acquisition of Metaco seems to be pushing it in the right direction. According to a tweet, Metaco can offer digital asset custodial services for about 80% of the banking sector, which is a huge figure.

This will enable $XRP to enjoy more extensive use cases.

Massive Ripple via Metaco/ GFT Digital Asset Customers Metaco and GFT can offer digital assets custody solution to an estimated 80% of the banking sector Full list of Metaco GFT technology partners below #ripple #xrp #crypto #blockchain pic.twitter.com/h8Hq5SBU62 — The light shines in the darkness (@MatthewLINY) June 6, 2023

Nonetheless, a new crypto project, DeeLance, is also toeing the same path as the Ripple blockchain. This innovative project is looking to radicalize the freelance industry.

DeeLance: Ripple’s Disruptor Twin

Outliers have been distinguished by their ability to alter an ancient system of doing things. This is what Ripple did with the SWIFT-controlled cross-border payment network.

Using blockchain technology, Ripple enabled anyone to send remittances to anywhere in the world at breakneck speed for a fraction of the cost.

DeeLance is also changing the narrative by allowing freelancers to tap into a new smart way to work and earn.

The platform is a decentralized recruitment protocol that allows freelancers and employers to work seamlessly. One of its best features is that it is an all-encompassing blockchain protocol.

Hey DeeLancers!👨‍💻#DeeLance Metaverse is all about socialize, work and earn! Build connections with other members in the Lobby Arena & conduct meetings for productive collaboration in the Metaverse Meeting Room🤝 Join $DLANCE #Presale!🚀https://t.co/XHnTqVzeWf#web3 #crypto pic.twitter.com/6IqS4Y9BVu — DeeLance (@deelance_com) June 9, 2023

Instead of only focusing on permissionless working digital co-spaces, it infuses non-fungible token (NFT) digital collectible technology through its marketplace.

As a result, anyone can own digital avatars to represent their online persona in the metaverse landscape.

Additionally, the NFT marketplace functions as a tokenization hub which allows freelancers to directly control their digital works. This reduces the pilfering and use of their work without proper compensation.

DeeLance also breaks the payment barrier like Ripple and makes it possible for freelancers to earn using crypto.

The platform is powered by an ERC-20 token called $DLANCE. The crypto asset is currently in presale and has raised over $1.3 million in the last couple of weeks.

Early-bird investors can buy DeeLance at its current presale value of $0.038 before the next price hike.

Buy $DLANCE Now
